items.title: Senior Nationals expected to quit portfolios after defying shadow cabinet
items.description: Three senior Nationals who voted against the Coalition's official position on hate speech reforms are expected to have to quit shadow cabinet for breaching rules requiring them to respect "cabinet solidarity".

items.title: Shattered father's tribute to teenager found dead on K'gari beach
items.description: The body of Canadian Piper James was found on K'gari (Fraser Island) surrounded by a pack of dingoes after she told friends she was going for an early morning swim.

items.title: Live: 'Sell America' trade in full swing as Trump threats hit Wall St
items.description: The Australian share market is set to fall for a third straight day as Wall Street tumbled to a one-month low on worsening relations between the US and Europe. Follow live.

items.title: Prime minister's national security adviser Philippa Brant resigns
items.description: Philippa Brant has resigned just months after the PM's top foreign policy adviser departed to run the Office of National Intelligence.

items.title: 'This is crazy': Europe weighs how to deal with Trump's Greenland threats
items.description: America's rattled European allies are debating how to stand up to Donald Trump after he escalated his threats to take over Greenland and pledged to punish its supporters with tariffs.

items.title: Donald Trump, the madman theory, and why even Australia is not safe
items.description: One year into Trump's second term, something has become clear: even those who leave the Oval Office with a deal, beware. It might not be worth the paper it's written on.

items.title: A year into Trump's second term, the Supreme Court's docket is full of legal challenges
items.description: A wide range of cases challenging Donald Trump's actions have landed on the Supreme Court's docket in the past year. Here's what to know

items.title: 'Perfect storm' driving alarming spate of NSW shark attacks
items.description: Shark populations are declining worldwide but NSW has already recorded the highest number of January attacks in a decade. A marine biologist says there are reasons sharks and people are coming into contact more often.

items.title: Live: Top seed Sabalenka running hot against outmatched world number 702
items.description: Half the Australian Open singles field has been whittled away as wildcard Talia Gibson kicks off second-round action on day four at Melbourne Park. Follow live.

items.title: One dead, at least 15 injured after another passsenger train derails near Barcelona
items.description: One person has died and at least 15 others have been injured after a containment wall fell onto a train track due to heavy rain near the Spanish city of Barcelona, local authorities say.

items.title: Queensland premier says national gun buyback doesn't address 'hate'
items.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese called on David Crisafulli to "justify" his refusal to join the national gun buyback scheme.

items.title: Spectacular aurora australis seen across Australia
items.description: A severe geomagnetic storm has hit Earth, providing for a colourful light show in Australia's skies.

items.title: Inside the program teaching US ICE agents to 'Defend the Homeland'
items.description: For the thousands of "patriots" who've applied, a position with ICE is a source of pride. Experts, elected officials and activists say otherwise.

items.title: First-home buyer abandons government scheme after constant setbacks
items.description: Erin Bell's efforts to both buy a house and build a new one through a government scheme were repeatedly challenged — once because she had disclosed a new boyfriend.

items.title: Samoa's PM proposes compulsory fasting, ban on non-Christian religions
items.description: Samoa's prime minister has thrown the future of its religious minorities into doubt after flagging potential restrictions on non-Christian faiths.

items.title: JD Vance and wife Usha expecting fourth child due in July
items.description: The vice-president and the second lady have been married since 2014 and share two sons and a daughter.

items.title: The public pool should be accessible for all — but for many, it isn't
items.description: A new exhibition in Western Sydney interrogates Australia's enduring love affair with the pool.

items.title: Could Paul Kelly and Hilltop Hoods break records in triple j's Hottest 100 of 2025?
items.description: Here's what might go down when triple j unveils the Hottest 100 of 2025 this Saturday.

items.title: Gen Z want their online order and they want it now
items.description: Small retailers are scrambling to keep up with deliveries as research shows Australian shoppers are expecting the same ultra-fast delivery they get from retail giants like Amazon. But some entrepreneurs have more than a few tricks up their sleeves to satisfy gen Z.

items.title: They're 'not worth much', so why are so many plants being stolen?
items.description: Data shows more than 2,000 items were reported stolen from gardens over a year in one state alone. So what can plant owners do to protect their beloved greenery from theft?

items.title: China's air force 'a potentially revolutionary threat' to Indo-Pacific, report says
items.description: Certain capabilities of China's air force now seriously challenge those of the US and other Western countries, with experts saying that it could tip the balance of any war over Taiwan in Beijing's favour.

items.title: Massive Chinese embassy in London approved despite 'nest of spies' concerns
items.description: The new embassy will sit in the city's Royal Mint Court alongside London's famous financial hub, despite experts and human rights groups raising concerns about foreign interference.

items.title: Cocoa-free chocolate sparks debate as brands grapple with market uncertainty
items.description: Cocoa substitutes are entering the chocolate market as the confectionery industry responds to volatile bean prices and supply.

items.title: Insurers flag premiums may rise after Victorian fires
items.description: Neighbours living on the same fire-ravaged street in regional Victoria are facing vastly different recoveries due to insurance differences, and recent disasters may push premiums further out of reach.

items.title: Death of Tim Picton puts spotlight on Australia's 'one-punch' laws
items.description: The death of Labor identity Tim Picton more than three weeks after he was allegedly assaulted outside a Perth nightclub has shocked Australia's political and business worlds and put the nation's one-punch laws under the microscope.
